result.execSummary:
The defendant Harley P Schrank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Restitution stipulation in the probation amount of $360.91 plus surcharge for a total of $397.00

Defendant Harley P Schrank in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CM40 and 16CM312.  Court sentenced defendant in 16CM40 Ct. 1 to pay $453.00 costs.  Ct. 2 $253.00 costs.  Restitution (paid prior to court today).  Submit DNA sample.  Defendant did serve 20 hours of community service prior to court and provided proof to DA.  In 16CM312 Court sentenced defendant to serve 10 days in jail, with Huber.  $443.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  2 days jail credit in each case.  Jail start on 12-13-16 at 7:00 pm.
